page.title: 13HOP FARMING IN LYNSTED (2)
page.content: Nowadays the casual labour needed is found locally. Londoners used to come hoppicking. They lived in hopper huts. For many people it was the annual holiday. In our school log we saw that they used to start school in late September because all the children used to work in the fields. Years ago three boys were beaten for cutting the hop strings on their way to school. Hops are a climbing plant. Their colour is green. Each plant can provide half a pint of stout. The hops have to be crushed. Nowadays the machines used are great big carriers that carry the hops into the shed. The hops are pulled out by metal arms and put onto a conveyor belt, which puts them through the shredder. Then they are carried into the oast houses. All this equipment is very expensive so it is very well-cared for & well greased.
